attributes.action: Allow Outdoor Football to Continue During the New National Restrictions (5 Nov)
attributes.additional_details: Numerous studies have found that the risk of Covid-19 transmission while playing football is negligible. A study by the Dutch FA found that 98% of matches present 'minimal or no risk' for footballers to transmit Covid-19 to one-another. Professor Chris Whitty recently said he was "not aware" of any cases of Covid-19 transmission between children playing football outdoors.
attributes.background: The government should make an exemption for the playing of football outdoors from the latest round of restrictions. The physical and mental benefits of the exercise provided by a game of football far outweigh the minimal risk of transmission during a match.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557467
